Meetings in the Metaverse | 2022 Guide

  • May 25, 2023
  • 4 min read
Table of contents

Corporate metaverses

The metaverse is transforming the way we work and interact. Corporate metaverses are virtual office spaces that replicate physical environments. Meetings in the metaverse utilize virtual reality technology to bring participants together using lifelike avatars. Meeting room metaverses offer cost savings, sustainability, and enhanced engagement.

Embracing metaverse meetings is crucial for businesses to stay ahead in the digital age and requires them to invest in VR technology and to establish corporate metaverses.

Metaverse meetings have the potential to revolutionize collaboration and innovation, shaping the future of work.

What is a metaverse meeting

Metaverse meetings utilize virtual reality technology to bring participants together using lifelike avatars within a shared digital space. Unlike traditional 2D meetings, metaverse office meetings take place in 3D environments, offering freedom of movement, fluidity, and flexibility. Participants can navigate through various spaces, contributing to different conversations and connecting with others in real-time.

Companies use virtual meetings to facilitate remote collaboration, connect with teams and clients worldwide, conduct training sessions, host webinars and virtual events, and efficiently communicate in real-time without the need for physical presence. Meetings in the metaverse offer convenience, cost-effectiveness, and the ability to bring people together regardless of geographical location, making them an essential tool for modern businesses.

What Do Meetings in the Metaverse Look Like

Example of meeting in the metaverse in custom made NFT Gallery

When it comes to hosting meetings in the metaverse, the goal is to create a truly immersive experience where team members can collaborate as if they were physically present in an office. The benefits discussed earlier come to life in the meeting environment.

Consider traditional Zoom meetings, where it can be challenging to stay engaged amidst the 2D sea of faces where some people don’t event turn on their cameras. Metaverse meetings offer a refreshing change.

In metaverse meetings, you can:

  • Monitor participation during conversations.
  • Track individual attention during meetings and interactions.
  • Analize head and hand gestures.
  • Capture facial expressions with sophisticated VR headsets.

  • Track individual attention during meetings and interactions.
  • Analize head and hand gestures.
  • Capture facial expressions with sophisticated VR headsets.

  3. Analize head and hand gestures.
  4. Capture facial expressions with sophisticated VR headsets.

Unlike video conferencing, which can be mentally fatiguing, metaverse team meetings offer a different experience. Instead of seeing your reflection on screen for hours on end, you’re able to utilize an avatar to represent you. This shift greatly reduces the overall stress and self-consciousness associated with traditional video calls.

In summary, meetings in the metaverse transcend the limitations of conventional video conferencing, providing a more engaging and natural environment for collaboration. Through avatars and immersive technology, participants can communicate, read visual cues, and interact with greater ease, making the entire meeting experience less taxing and more enjoyable.

Corporate Metaverses & Virtual Reality Meetings

Corporate metaverses are digital domains created by businesses to replicate physical work environments in the virtual realm. These virtual offices provide employees with a familiar setting while offering the advantages of remote work.

Within corporate metaverses, virtual reality meeting platforms take center stage, enabling teams to collaborate seamlessly, regardless of geographical locations. These meetings foster engagement, inclusivity, and innovation, redefining the future of business interactions.

Virtual Reality Business Meetings: Delivering Meetings in 3D vs 2D

Corporate metaverses are digital domains created by businesses to replicate physical work environments in the virtual realm. These virtual offices provide employees with a familiar setting while offering the advantages of remote work.

2D Virtual Business Meetings

2D virtual business meetings utilize traditional video conferencing tools and platforms, allowing participants to interact through video and audio. While they offer basic communication capabilities, they lack the immersive and engaging features of 3D virtual meeting rooms.

Here are some characteristics of 2D virtual business meetings:

  • Communication: Participants can see and hear each other through video and audio streams.
  • Visual Context: Limited visual cues and spatial awareness, as participants are displayed on a flat screen.
  • Engagement: Limited opportunities for non-verbal communication and physical presence cues.
  • Realism: Does not replicate the physical office environment or provide a sense of presence.

“In a world older and more complete than ours they move finished and complete, gifted with extensions of the senses we have lost or never attained, living by voices we shall never hear.”

— Olivia Rhye, Product Designer

3D Virtual Business Meetings

In contrast, 3D meetings leverage immersive virtual reality technology to create dynamic and lifelike meeting spaces. These meetings offer more engaging and realistic experiences for participants. Here are some key features:

In contrast, 3D meetings leverage immersive virtual reality technology to create dynamic and lifelike meeting spaces. These meetings offer more engaging and realistic experiences for participants. Here are some key features:

  • Avatars: Participants are presented as customizable avatars, providing a sense of presence and individuality.
  • Spatial Awareness: Enhanced spatial audio and visual representation, allow participants to perceive the meeting environment more naturally.
  • Collaboration Tools: Meeting spaces can be fully customized to resemble physical offices or create unique environments that suit specific needs.
  • Non-Verbal Communication: Avatars can gesture, use body language, and express emotions, fostering more nuanced interactions.
  • Immersion: Participants feel immersed in the virtual environment, promoting a stronger sense of connection and engagement.
  • Customization: Meeting spaces can be fully customized to resemble physical offices or create unique environments that suit specific needs.
  • Immersion: Participants feel immersed in the virtual environment, promoting a stronger sense of connection and engagement.
Aspect Metaverse Marketing Traditional Marketing
Branding Experience Empowers brands to create immersive virtual realms embodying identity Often relies on videos, images, and text
Customer Interaction Offers unique interactive experiences within personal space Limited to passive engagement through ads and content
Competitive Edge Confers competitive edge through innovation and novelty May struggle to stand out due to the saturation of traditional methods
Challenges and Risks Presents risks such as measurement complexities and gradual adoption Challenges vary but may include ad effectiveness and targeting
Brand Autonomy Fosters decentralization, allowing brands to create their universe Relies on existing platforms and channels

3D spaces for meeting offer a more interactive and immersive meeting experience, facilitating better collaboration, creativity, and productivity. By leveraging the power of virtual reality, organizations can transcend the limitations of traditional 2D meetings and unlock new possibilities for remote work and global collaboration.
